intro: Anemopaegma brachycalyx, commonly known as the narrow-calyx anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible species. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Anemopaegma brachycalyx is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
